Disappointed with this bank, its manager and their so-called protocol. The exchange machine stole 500 euros from us and only gave us back 500 dirhams. We went to see the manager who told us it's not his responsibility!!! We had to wait for the Casablanca headquarters to give their agreement. It was supposedly 3 days. To date it has been 3 weeks we have not been reimbursed. We were told to leave the Rib from my account in Morocco so that they would pay us our money. However, the manager asked us a few days ago that the best thing is to open an account with them so that they can pay us our money!!! But how can you not get angry with these people!!! Who do they take us for? We are nationals. We love our country. And that's why we come for 3 to 4 weeks of vacation. There is something to disgust you! It is unacceptable to treat us like this. I hope that my message will end up in the hands of higher officials so that our situation can be resolved quickly! We left our Rib on two occasions. THANKS. A word to the wise.

The Moroccan Bank for Commerce and Industry (BMCI)¬†is one of the most widely used financial institutions currently in Morocco because of the quality of its services and banking products offered as well as its approach to its customers, whether direct or remotely.

BMCI was actually created in 1943 but in order to have a close financial relationship between France and Morocco, the BNP Paribas Group which is a public limited company had taken it among its subsidiaries in 1964. The network being integrated into the euro zone and which currently covers more than 80 countries internationally. This had obtained through the BNP several partners throughout the world, apart from the BMCE Bank which is already established in Morocco as well as the Attijariwafa bank, the Casablanca Stock Exchange and the Banque Populaire du Maroc, we can cite a few placed in certain regions: in Burkina Faso, in Algeria, in the Comoros, in Benin in Cameroon, in Cape Verde, in China, in Gabon, in the Congo in Madagascar, in Brazil, in Togo, Cambodia, Turkey, Mauritius, Guinea, Sri Lanka, and Haiti‚Ä¶

The important strengths which motivated customers to be interested in opening an account with it are mainly because of its fairly reasonable prices compared to other organizations, opening an account is very easy and almost free of charge; by the diversification of the ranges of credits granted, many people are pushed to integrate into it.

Its speed in transactions is widely recognized; its attractive interest and foreign exchange rates are encouraging. Its collaboration with Western Union and other entities by acting as an intermediary in the money transfer system from inside to outside or vice versa, provides it with many advantages both in its relationships with customers and in its own turnover obtained by the commissions received.

Regarding the financial results, BMCI was able to bring out an increase of 4.5% in products in 2014 compared to those of 2013 despite the drop in the BNP Group's results of 33%. On the other hand, the operating coefficient of the said is 48% which still places it among the best Moroccan banks.

The future outlook for BMCI is flourishing in all discount and credit banking operations.

The Moroccan Bank for Commerce and Industry (BMCI)¬†is one of the most widely used financial institutions currently in Morocco because of the quality of its services and banking products offered as well as its approach to its customers, whether direct or remotely.

BMCI was actually created in 1943 but in order to have a close financial relationship between France and Morocco, the BNP Paribas Group which is a public limited company had taken it among its subsidiaries in 1964. The network being integrated into the euro zone and which currently covers more than 80 countries internationally. This had obtained through the BNP several partners throughout the world, apart from the BMCE Bank which is already established in Morocco as well as the Attijariwafa bank, the Casablanca Stock Exchange and the Banque Populaire du Maroc, we can cite a few placed in certain regions: in Burkina Faso, in Algeria, in the Comoros, in Benin in Cameroon, in Cape Verde, in China, in Gabon, in the Congo in Madagascar, in Brazil, in Togo, Cambodia, Turkey, Mauritius, Guinea, Sri Lanka, and Haiti‚Ä¶

The important strengths which motivated customers to be interested in opening an account with it are mainly because of its fairly reasonable prices compared to other organizations, opening an account is very easy and almost free of charge; by the diversification of the ranges of credits granted, many people are pushed to integrate into it.

Its speed in transactions is widely recognized; its attractive interest and foreign exchange rates are encouraging. Its collaboration with Western Union and other entities by acting as an intermediary in the money transfer system from inside to outside or vice versa, provides it with many advantages both in its relationships with customers and in its own turnover obtained by the commissions received.

Regarding the financial results, BMCI was able to bring out an increase of 4.5% in products in 2014 compared to those of 2013 despite the drop in the BNP Group's results of 33%. On the other hand, the operating coefficient of the said is 48% which still places it among the best Moroccan banks.

The future outlook for BMCI is flourishing in all discount and credit banking operations.
